page.title: 17HALE VILLAGE
page.content: {HALE VILLAGE}The Village has a population of approximatly 2,000 and is expanding. The Local dignitaries are the local{Freeman}and{Lord Mayor, {all honoury.}There is one policeman with van, who has assistance from Widnes. A{Home Watch}scheme for house protection, a moderate bus frequency, most have use of a car, the fare to Liverpool(18km), Widnes(5km) is 0.3 of average lowly wage. Milk delivery 1.3 pints per person per day, local shops used moderately, supplies at Widnes and Liverpool. Local flowers a feature, passing trade. Youth club, Keep fit, Brownies, Scouts and Guides. School for 5 -11 years. Mainly three types of housing, small group (17 round old village centre and old tied cottages of hall; small (19 in fill housing spread over village), and the new estates.
